data.title: Hotels and Restaurants in Paris : Where to go in Paris ?
data.meta_description: Hotels and Restaurants in Paris : Where to go in Paris ? - Paris Ouest Sotheby's International Realty - Find out the best places to go in Paris with your expert in real estate in Paris.
data.text:
" La Samaritaine "

After a wait of 16 years, la Samaritaine officially opens again its doors

It was one of the most awaited architectural events of the year. La Samaritaine, iconic department store of the capital closed since 2005 because of deterioration, has finally opened again 23 June. With a budget of 500 million euros, LVMH company, which bought back the store in 2001, appealed to the Japanese architect’s office SANAA (winner of the Pritzker price in 2010) and Jean-François...

Read more

What’s new in Art, Architecture, And Design?

RESIDE

First of all, high-tech science has become a creative force in the art world. London-based artist Susan Aldworth for instance explores the human identity and mind/consciousness in association with scientists. Klari Reis, a painted based in San Francisco, experiments with new materials and methods for her scientifically themed works and collaborates with biomedical companies. She says she is...

Read more

Hotel - Ritz Paris

Allying tradition, modernity and innovation, the Ritz Paris is undoubtedly one of the world’s finest hotels. In the heart of Paris, French elegance is highlighted thanks to this palace’s refined, noble and luxurious décor. Appreciated over the decades by a multitude of celebrities, among them Marcel Proust, Charlie Chaplin and the Prince of Wales, the Ritz reopened after almost four year’s...

Read more

Hotel - Crayon

Created in the style of a guest house, the Hôtel Crayon welcomes guests in a bright contemporary décor reminiscent of an artist’s workshop. In the heart of the capital’s 1st District just a stone’s throw from the Louvre and iconic Rue de Rivoli, this unique hotel is an ideal base for a few unforgettable days in Paris. 25 rue Bouloi 75001 Paris https://hotelcrayon.com/fr/

Read more

Hotel - Le Shangri-La

A visit to the Shangri-La Hôtel, Paris just a stone’s throw from Trocadéro is a journey through time. Originally home to Prince Roland Bonaparte, grandson of Lucien and elder brother of Napoleon, the Hotel Particulier which was built by Ernest Janty and inaugurated at the end of 1899 has preserved much of its original charm. The former Royal residence’s spectacular entrance gallery is quite...

Read more

Restaurant - Apicius

Apicius is among the finest tables in the capital. Located in the heart of Paris this magnificent restaurant and its chef Mathieu Pacaud serve its patrons classical, modern, delicate and generous haute gastronomie. The decor in this superb Hotel Particulier is remarkable: here a moment of serenity and unashamed self indulgence is guaranteed in the heart of the capital. 20 rue d’Artois, 75008...

Read more

Hotel - The Peninsula Paris

Built in 1908 as the Majestic Hotel, in 1937 the building became an annex to the Defense Ministry. During the war, it was used as the German general staff HQ before becoming once more a HQ between 1946 and 1958, this time for UNESCO. In 2014, the building was transformed into the Peninsula Hotel. In a prime location near avenue Kléber just a stone’s throw from many iconic landmarks, The...

Read more

Restaurant - Oiseau Blanc

On the sixth floor of the Peninsula Hotel, the Oiseau Blanc commands an open view of the capital’s most iconic landmarks, contributing to its deserved reputation as one of the most exceptional and distinguished restaurants in Paris. In an original decor evoking aviation’s finest hours, this restaurant is truly original. The dishes served are authentically French, elegant and audacious...

Read more

Hotel - Saint James Paris

To stay in the Saint James Paris Hotel is a unique « crazy-chic » experience. A Relais & Château and a private club, this magnificent private mansion dating from 1890 was originally built for Mlle Dosne, President Adolphe Thiers’ sister in law, who transformed it in 1892 into an educational institute for particularly gifted children, becoming the Thiers Foundation. The Saint James Paris...

Read more
